description: Test Copilot libraries filtering from semantic API

typeDefs.name: AUTH_HEADER
typeDefs.description: Represents the Authorization header name.

typeDefs.name: AUTH_SCHEME_BASIC
typeDefs.description: The prefix used to denote the Basic authentication scheme.

typeDefs.name: AUTH_SCHEME_BEARER
typeDefs.description: The prefix used to denote the Bearer authentication scheme.

typeDefs.name: NO_CACHE
typeDefs.description: Forces the cache to validate a cached response with the origin server before serving.

typeDefs.name: NO_STORE
typeDefs.description: Instructs the cache to not store a response in non-volatile storage.

typeDefs.name: NO_TRANSFORM
typeDefs.description: Instructs intermediaries not to transform the payload.

typeDefs.name: MAX_AGE
typeDefs.description:
When used in requests, `max-age` implies that clients are not willing to accept responses whose age is greater
than `max-age`. When used in responses, the response is to be considered stale after the specified
number of seconds.

typeDefs.name: MAX_STALE
typeDefs.description:
Indicates that the client is willing to accept responses which have exceeded their freshness lifetime by no more
than the specified number of seconds.

typeDefs.name: MIN_FRESH
typeDefs.description: Indicates that the client is only accepting responses whose freshness lifetime >= current age + min-fresh.

typeDefs.name: ONLY_IF_CACHED
typeDefs.description:
Indicates that the client is only willing to accept a cached response. A cached response is served subject to
other constraints posed by the request.

typeDefs.name: MUST_REVALIDATE
typeDefs.description:
Indicates that once the response has become stale, it should not be reused for subsequent requests without
validating with the origin server.

typeDefs.name: PUBLIC
typeDefs.description: Indicates that any cache may store the response.

typeDefs.name: PRIVATE
typeDefs.description: Indicates that the response is intended for a single user and should not be stored by shared caches.

typeDefs.name: PROXY_REVALIDATE
typeDefs.description: Has the same semantics as `must-revalidate`, except that this does not apply to private caches.

typeDefs.name: S_MAX_AGE
typeDefs.description: In shared caches, `s-maxage` overrides the `max-age` or `expires` header field.

typeDefs.name: MAX_STALE_ANY_AGE
typeDefs.description: Setting this as the `max-stale` directives indicates that the `max-stale` directive does not specify a limit.

typeDefs.name: CACHE_CONTROL_AND_VALIDATORS
typeDefs.description:
This is a more restricted mode of RFC 7234. Setting this as the caching policy restricts caching to instances
where the `cache-control` header and either the `etag` or `last-modified` header are present.

typeDefs.name: RFC_7234
typeDefs.description: Caching behaviour is as specified by the RFC 7234 specification.

typeDefs.name: CHUNKING_AUTO
typeDefs.description:
If the payload is less than 8KB, content-length header is set in the outbound request/response,
otherwise chunking header is set in the outbound request/response.}

typeDefs.name: CHUNKING_ALWAYS
typeDefs.description: Always set chunking header in the response.

typeDefs.name: CHUNKING_NEVER
typeDefs.description: Never set the chunking header even if the payload is larger than 8KB in the outbound request/response.

typeDefs.name: COMPRESSION_AUTO
typeDefs.description:
When service behaves as a HTTP gateway inbound request/response accept-encoding option is set as the
outbound request/response accept-encoding/content-encoding option.

typeDefs.name: COMPRESSION_ALWAYS
typeDefs.description: Always set accept-encoding/content-encoding in outbound request/response.

typeDefs.name: COMPRESSION_NEVER
typeDefs.description: Never set accept-encoding/content-encoding header in outbound request/response.

typeDefs.name: LEADING
typeDefs.description: Header is placed before the payload of the request/response.

typeDefs.name: TRAILING
typeDefs.description: Header is placed after the payload of the request/response.

typeDefs.name: JWT_INFORMATION
typeDefs.description: Constant to get the jwt information from the request context.

typeDefs.name: AGE
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `age`. Gives the current age of a cached HTTP response.

typeDefs.name: AUTHORIZATION
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `authorization`

typeDefs.name: CACHE_CONTROL
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `cache-control`. Specifies the cache control directives required for the function of HTTP caches.

typeDefs.name: CONTENT_LENGTH
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `content-length`. Specifies the size of the response body in bytes.

typeDefs.name: CONTENT_TYPE
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `content-type`. Specifies the type of the message payload.

typeDefs.name: DATE
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `date`. The timestamp at the time the response was generated/received.

typeDefs.name: ETAG
typeDefs.description:
HTTP header key `etag`. A finger print for a resource which is used by HTTP caches to identify whether a
resource representation has changed.

typeDefs.name: EXPECT
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `expect`. Specifies expectations to be fulfilled by the server.

typeDefs.name: EXPIRES
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `expires`. Specifies the time at which the response becomes stale.

typeDefs.name: IF_MATCH
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `if-match`

typeDefs.name: IF_MODIFIED_SINCE
typeDefs.description:
HTTP header key `if-modified-since`. Used when validating (with the origin server) whether a cached response
is still valid. If the representation of the resource has modified since the timestamp in this field, a
304 response is returned.

typeDefs.name: IF_NONE_MATCH
typeDefs.description:
HTTP header key `if-none-match`. Used when validating (with the origin server) whether a cached response is
still valid. If the ETag provided in this field matches the representation of the requested resource, a
304 response is returned.

typeDefs.name: IF_RANGE
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `if-range`

typeDefs.name: IF_UNMODIFIED_SINCE
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `if-unmodified-since`

typeDefs.name: LAST_MODIFIED
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `last-modified`. The time at which the resource was last modified.

typeDefs.name: LOCATION
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `location`. Indicates the URL to redirect a request to.

typeDefs.name: PRAGMA
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `pragma`. Used in dealing with HTTP 1.0 caches which do not understand the `cache-control` header.

typeDefs.name: PROXY_AUTHORIZATION
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `proxy-authorization`. Contains the credentials to authenticate a user agent to a proxy serve.

typeDefs.name: SERVER
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `server`. Specifies the details of the origin server.

typeDefs.name: WARNING
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `warning`. Specifies warnings generated when serving stale responses from HTTP caches.

typeDefs.name: TRANSFER_ENCODING
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `transfer-encoding`. Specifies what type of transformation has been applied to entity body.

typeDefs.name: CONNECTION
typeDefs.description: HTTP header key `connection`. Allows the sender to specify options that are desired for that particular connection.

typeDefs.name: UPGRADE
typeDefs.description:
HTTP header key `upgrade`. Allows the client to specify what additional communication protocols it supports and
would like to use, if the server finds it appropriate to switch protocols.

typeDefs.name: PASSED
typeDefs.description: Mutual SSL handshake is successful.

typeDefs.name: FAILED
typeDefs.description: Mutual SSL handshake has failed.

typeDefs.name: NONE
typeDefs.description: Not a mutual ssl connection.

typeDefs.name: KEEPALIVE_AUTO
typeDefs.description: Decides to keep the connection alive or not based on the `connection` header of the client request }

typeDefs.name: KEEPALIVE_ALWAYS
typeDefs.description: Keeps the connection alive irrespective of the `connection` header value }

typeDefs.name: KEEPALIVE_NEVER
typeDefs.description: Closes the connection irrespective of the `connection` header value }

typeDefs.name: CB_OPEN_STATE
typeDefs.description:
Represents the open state of the circuit. When the Circuit Breaker is in `OPEN` state, requests will fail
immediately.

typeDefs.name: CB_HALF_OPEN_STATE
typeDefs.description:
Represents the half-open state of the circuit. When the Circuit Breaker is in `HALF_OPEN` state, a trial request
will be sent to the upstream service. If it fails, the circuit will trip again and move to the `OPEN` state. If not,
it will move to the `CLOSED` state.

typeDefs.name: CB_CLOSED_STATE
typeDefs.description:
Represents the closed state of the circuit. When the Circuit Breaker is in `CLOSED` state, all requests will be
allowed to go through to the upstream service. If the failures exceed the configured threhold values, the circuit
will trip and move to the `OPEN` state.

fields.name: evictionFactor
fields.description:
The fraction of entries to be removed when the cache is full. The value should be
between 0 (exclusive) and 1 (inclusive).

fields.name: policy
fields.description:
Gives the user some control over the caching behaviour. By default, this is set to
`CACHE_CONTROL_AND_VALIDATORS`. The default behaviour is to allow caching only when the `cache-control`
header and either the `etag` or `last-modified` header are present.

typeDefs.name: CookieOptions
typeDefs.description: The options to be used when initializing the `http:Cookie`.

fields.name: path
fields.description: URI path to which the cookie belongs

fields.name: domain
fields.description: Host to which the cookie will be sent

fields.name: expires
fields.description: Maximum lifetime of the cookie represented as the date and time at which the cookie expires

fields.name: maxAge
fields.description: Maximum lifetime of the cookie represented as the number of seconds until the cookie expires

fields.name: httpOnly
fields.description: Cookie is sent only to HTTP requests

fields.name: secure
fields.description: Cookie is sent only to secure channels

fields.name: createdTime
fields.description: At what time the cookie was created

fields.name: lastAccessedTime
fields.description: Last-accessed time of the cookie

fields.name: hostOnly
fields.description: Cookie is sent only to the requested host

typeDefs.name: PersistentCookieHandler
typeDefs.description: The representation of a persistent cookie handler object type for managing persistent cookies.

fields.name: compression

fields.name: chunking
fields.description: Configures the chunking behaviour for the service

fields.name: cors
fields.description: The cross origin resource sharing configurations for the service

fields.name: auth
fields.description: Service auth configurations

fields.name: mediaTypeSubtypePrefix
fields.description: Service specific media-type subtype prefix

fields.name: treatNilableAsOptional
fields.description: Treat Nilable parameters as optional

fields.name: openApiDefinition
fields.description: The generated OpenAPI definition for the HTTP service. This is auto-generated at compile-time if OpenAPI doc auto generation is enabled

fields.name: validation
fields.description: Enables the inbound payload validation functionality which provided by the constraint package. Enabled by default

fields.name: serviceType
fields.description: The service object type which defines the service contract. This is auto-generated at compile-time

fields.name: basePath
fields.description: Base path to be used with the service implementation. This is only allowed on service contract types

fields.name: laxDataBinding
fields.description:
Enables or disables relaxed data binding on the service side. Disabled by default. 
When enabled, the JSON data will be projected to the Ballerina record type and during the projection,
nil values will be considered as optional fields and absent fields will be considered for nilable types

typeDefs.name: CompressionConfig
typeDefs.description: A record for providing configurations for content compression.

fields.name: enable
fields.description: The status of compression

fields.name: contentTypes
fields.description: Content types which are allowed for compression

typeDefs.name: Compression
typeDefs.description:
Options to compress using gzip or deflate.

`AUTO`: When service behaves as a HTTP gateway inbound request/response accept-encoding option is set as the
outbound request/response accept-encoding/content-encoding option
`ALWAYS`: Always set accept-encoding/content-encoding in outbound request/response
`NEVER`: Never set accept-encoding/content-encoding header in outbound request/response

typeDefs.name: Chunking
typeDefs.description:
Defines the possible values for the chunking configuration in HTTP services and clients.

`AUTO`: If the payload is less than 8KB, content-length header is set in the outbound request/response,
otherwise chunking header is set in the outbound request/response
`ALWAYS`: Always set chunking header in the response
`NEVER`: Never set the chunking header even if the payload is larger than 8KB in the outbound request/response

functions.name: getEntity
functions.description: Gets the `Entity` associated with the response.

return.description: The `Entity` of the response. An `http:ClientError` is returned, if entity construction fails

functions.name: setEntity
functions.description: Sets the provided `Entity` to the response.

parameters.name: e
parameters.description: The `Entity` to be set to the response

functions.name: hasHeader
functions.description: Checks whether the requested header key exists in the header map.

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: The header name

parameters.name: position
parameters.description: Represents the position of the header as an optional parameter

return.description: `true` if the specified header key exists

functions.name: getHeader
functions.description:
Returns the value of the specified header. If the specified header key maps to multiple values, the first of
these values is returned.

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: The header name

parameters.name: position
parameters.description:
Represents the position of the header as an optional parameter. If the position is `http:TRAILING`,
the entity-body of the `Response` must be accessed initially.

return.description:
The first header value for the specified header name or the `HeaderNotFoundError` if the header is not
found.

functions.name: addHeader
functions.description:
Adds the specified header to the response. Existing header values are not replaced, except for the `Content-Type`
header. In the case of the `Content-Type` header, the existing value is replaced with the specified value.
. Panic if an illegal header is passed.

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: The header name

parameters.name: headerValue
parameters.description: The header value

parameters.name: position
parameters.description:
Represents the position of the header as an optional parameter. If the position is `http:TRAILING`,
the entity-body of the `Response` must be accessed initially.

functions.name: getHeaders
functions.description: Gets all the header values to which the specified header key maps to.

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: The header name

parameters.name: position
parameters.description:
Represents the position of the header as an optional parameter. If the position is `http:TRAILING`,
the entity-body of the `Response` must be accessed initially.

return.description:
The header values the specified header key maps to or the `HeaderNotFoundError` if the header is not
found.

functions.name: setHeader
functions.description:
Sets the specified header to the response. If a mapping already exists for the specified header key, the
existing header value is replaced with the specified header value. Panic if an illegal header is passed.

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: The header name

parameters.name: headerValue
parameters.description: The header value

parameters.name: position
parameters.description:
Represents the position of the header as an optional parameter. If the position is `http:TRAILING`,
the entity-body of the `Response` must be accessed initially.

functions.name: removeHeader
functions.description: Removes the specified header from the response.

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: The header name

parameters.name: position
parameters.description:
Represents the position of the header as an optional parameter. If the position is `http:TRAILING`,
the entity-body of the `Response` must be accessed initially.

functions.name: removeAllHeaders
functions.description: Removes all the headers from the response.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description:
Represents the position of the header as an optional parameter. If the position is `http:TRAILING`,
the entity-body of the `Response` must be accessed initially.

functions.name: getHeaderNames
functions.description: Gets all the names of the headers of the response.

parameters.name: position
parameters.description:
Represents the position of the header as an optional parameter. If the position is `http:TRAILING`,
the entity-body of the `Response` must be accessed initially.

return.description: An array of all the header names

functions.name: setContentType
functions.description: Sets the `content-type` header to the response.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: Content type value to be set as the `content-type` header

return.description: Nil if successful, error in case of invalid content-type

functions.name: getContentType
functions.description: Gets the type of the payload of the response (i.e., the `content-type` header value).

return.description: The `content-type` header value as a string

functions.name: getJsonPayload
functions.description:
Extract `json` payload from the response. For an empty payload, `http:NoContentError` is returned.

If the content type is not JSON, an `http:ClientError` is returned.

return.description: The `json` payload or `http:ClientError` in case of errors

functions.name: getXmlPayload
functions.description:
Extracts `xml` payload from the response. For an empty payload, `http:NoContentError` is returned.

If the content type is not XML, an `http:ClientError` is returned.

return.description: The `xml` payload or `http:ClientError` in case of errors

functions.name: getTextPayload
functions.description:
Extracts `text` payload from the response. For an empty payload, `http:NoContentError` is returned.

If the content type is not of type text, an `http:ClientError` is returned.

return.description: The string representation of the message payload or `http:ClientError` in case of errors

functions.name: getByteStream
functions.description:
Gets the response payload as  a stream of byte[], except in the case of multiparts. To retrieve multiparts, use
`Response.getBodyParts()`.

parameters.name: arraySize
parameters.description: A defaultable parameter to state the size of the byte array. Default size is 8KB

return.description: A byte stream from which the message payload can be read or `http:ClientError` in case of errors

functions.name: getBinaryPayload
functions.description: Gets the response payload as a `byte[]`.

return.description: The byte[] representation of the message payload or `http:ClientError` in case of errors

functions.name: getSseEventStream
functions.description: Gets the response payload as a `stream` of SseEvent.

return.description: A SseEvent stream from which the `http:SseEvent` can be read or `http:ClientError` in case of errors

functions.name: getBodyParts
functions.description: Extracts body parts from the response. If the content type is not a composite media type, an error is returned.

return.description:
The body parts as an array of entities or else an `http:ClientError` if there were any errors in
constructing the body parts from the response

functions.name: setETag
functions.description: Sets the `etag` header for the given payload. The ETag is generated using a CRC32 hash isolated function.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The payload for which the ETag should be set

functions.name: setLastModified
functions.description: Sets the current time as the `last-modified` header.

functions.name: setJsonPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `json` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/json`. Any existing content-type can be
overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `json` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/json` is the default value

functions.name: setAnydataAsJsonPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `anydata` payaload, as a `json` payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/json`. Any existing content-type can be
overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `json` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/json` is the default value

functions.name: setXmlPayload
functions.description:
Sets an `xml` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/xml`. Any existing content-type can be
overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `xml` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/xml` is the default value

functions.name: setTextPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `string` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set
content-type headers with the default content-type, which is `text/plain`. Any
existing content-type can be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `string` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `text/plain` is the default value

functions.name: setBinaryPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `byte[]` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/octet-stream`. Any existing content-type
can be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `byte[]` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/octet-stream` is the default value

functions.name: setBodyParts
functions.description:
Set multiparts as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method
set content-type headers with the default content-type, which is `multipart/form-data`.
Any existing content-type can be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: bodyParts
parameters.description: The entities which make up the message body

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the top level message. This is an optional parameter.
The `multipart/form-data` is the default value

functions.name: setFileAsPayload
functions.description:
Sets the content of the specified file as the entity body of the response. If the content-type header
is not set then this method set content-type headers with the default content-type, which is
`application/octet-stream`. Any existing content-type can be overridden by passing the content-type
as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Path to the file to be set as the payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the specified file. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/octet-stream` is the default value

functions.name: setByteStream
functions.description:
Sets a `Stream` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/octet-stream`. Any existing content-type can
be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: byteStream
parameters.description: Byte stream, which needs to be set to the response

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
Content-type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/octet-stream` is the default value

functions.name: setSseEventStream
functions.description:
Sets an `http:SseEvent` stream as the payload, along with the Content-Type and Cache-Control 
headers set to 'text/event-stream' and 'no-cache', respectively.

parameters.name: eventStream
parameters.description: SseEvent stream, which needs to be set to the response

functions.name: setPayload
functions.description:
Sets the response payload. This method overrides any existing content-type by passing the content-type
as an optional parameter. If the content type parameter is not provided then the default value derived
from the payload will be used as content-type only when there are no existing content-type header. If
the payload is non-json typed value then the value is converted to json using the `toJson` method.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description:
Payload can be of type `string`, `xml`, `byte[]`, `json`, `stream<byte[], io:Error?>`,
stream<SseEvent, error?>(represents Server-Sent events), `Entity[]` (i.e., a set of body
parts) or any other value of type `anydata` which will be converted to `json` using the
`toJson` method.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: Content-type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter

functions.name: addCookie
functions.description: Adds the cookie to response.

parameters.name: cookie
parameters.description: The cookie, which is added to response

functions.description: Deletes the cookies in the client's cookie store.

functions.description: Gets cookies from the response.

functions.description: Gets the status code response record from the response.

typeDefs.name: HttpHeader
typeDefs.description: Defines the Header resource signature parameter.

fields.name: name

typeDefs.name: HttpQuery

typeDefs.name: HttpCacheConfig
typeDefs.description:
Defines the HTTP response cache configuration. By default the `no-cache` directive is setted to the `cache-control`
header. In addition to that `etag` and `last-modified` headers are also added for cache validation.

fields.name: mustRevalidate
fields.description: Sets the `must-revalidate` directive

fields.name: noCache
fields.description: Sets the `no-cache` directive

fields.name: noStore
fields.description: Sets the `no-store` directive

fields.name: noTransform
fields.description: Sets the `no-transform` directive

fields.name: isPrivate
fields.description: Sets the `private` and `public` directives

fields.name: proxyRevalidate
fields.description: Sets the `proxy-revalidate` directive

fields.name: maxAge
fields.description: Sets the `max-age` directive. Default value is 3600 seconds

fields.name: sMaxAge
fields.description: Sets the `s-maxage` directive

fields.name: noCacheFields
fields.description:
Optional fields for the `no-cache` directive. Before sending a listed field in a response, it
must be validated with the origin server

fields.name: privateFields
fields.description:
Optional fields for the `private` directive. A cache can omit the fields specified and store
the rest of the response

fields.name: setETag
fields.description: Sets the `etag` header for the given payload

fields.name: setLastModified
fields.description: Sets the current time as the `last-modified` header

typeDefs.name: TargetService
typeDefs.description: Represents a single service and its related configurations.

fields.name: url
fields.description: URL of the target service

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description: Configurations for secure communication with the remote HTTP endpoint

typeDefs.name: ClientSecureSocket
typeDefs.description: Provides configurations for facilitating secure communication with a remote HTTP endpoint.

fields.name: enable
fields.description: Enable SSL validation

fields.name: cert
fields.description: Configurations associated with `crypto:TrustStore` or single certificate file that the client trusts

fields.name: key
fields.description: Configurations associated with `crypto:KeyStore` or combination of certificate and private key of the client

fields.name: protocol
fields.description: SSL/TLS protocol related options

fields.name: certValidation
fields.description: Certificate validation against OCSP_CRL, OCSP_STAPLING related options

fields.name: ciphers
fields.description:
List of ciphers to be used
eg: TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256, TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_CBC_SHA

fields.name: verifyHostName
fields.description: Enable/disable host name verification

fields.name: shareSession
fields.description: Enable/disable new SSL session creation

fields.name: handshakeTimeout
fields.description: SSL handshake time out

fields.name: sessionTimeout
fields.description: SSL session time out

fields.name: serverName
fields.description: Server name indication(SNI) to be used. If this is not present, hostname from the target URL will be used

typeDefs.name: CertKey
typeDefs.description: Represents combination of certificate, private key and private key password if encrypted.

fields.name: certFile
fields.description: A file containing the certificate

fields.name: keyFile
fields.description: A file containing the private key in PKCS8 format

fields.name: keyPassword
fields.description: Password of the private key if it is encrypted

typeDefs.name: Protocol
typeDefs.description: Represents protocol options.

typeDefs.name: CertValidationType
typeDefs.description: Represents certification validation type options.

typeDefs.name: CommonClientConfiguration
typeDefs.description: Common client configurations for the next level clients.

fields.name: httpVersion
fields.description: HTTP protocol version supported by the client

fields.name: http1Settings
fields.description: HTTP/1.x specific settings

fields.name: http2Settings
fields.description: HTTP/2 specific settings

fields.name: timeout
fields.description: Maximum time(in seconds) to wait for a response before the request times out

fields.name: forwarded
fields.description: The choice of setting `Forwarded`/`X-Forwarded-For` header, when acting as a proxy

fields.name: followRedirects
fields.description: HTTP redirect handling configurations (with 3xx status codes)

fields.name: poolConfig
fields.description: Configurations associated with the request connection pool

fields.name: cache
fields.description: HTTP response caching related configurations

fields.name: compression
fields.description: Enable request/response compression (using `accept-encoding` header)

fields.name: auth
fields.description: Client authentication options (Basic, Bearer token, OAuth, etc.)

fields.name: circuitBreaker
fields.description: Circuit breaker configurations to prevent cascading failures

fields.name: retryConfig
fields.description: Automatic retry settings for failed requests

fields.name: cookieConfig
fields.description: Cookie handling settings for session management

fields.name: responseLimits
fields.description: Limits for response size and headers (to prevent memory issues)

fields.name: proxy
fields.description: Proxy server settings if requests need to go through a proxy

fields.name: validation
fields.description: Enable automatic payload validation for request/response data against constraints

fields.name: socketConfig
fields.description: Low-level socket settings (timeouts, buffer sizes, etc.)

fields.name: laxDataBinding
fields.description:
Enable relaxed data binding on the client side.
When enabled:
- `null` values in JSON are allowed to be mapped to optional fields
- missing fields in JSON are allowed to be mapped as `null` values

typeDefs.name: HttpVersion
typeDefs.description: Defines the supported HTTP protocols.

typeDefs.name: ClientHttp1Settings
typeDefs.description: Provides settings related to HTTP/1.x protocol.

fields.name: keepAlive
fields.description: Specifies whether to reuse a connection for multiple requests

fields.name: chunking
fields.description: The chunking behaviour of the request

fields.name: proxy
fields.description: Proxy server related options

typeDefs.name: KeepAlive
typeDefs.description: Defines the possible values for the keep-alive configuration in service and client endpoints.

typeDefs.name: ProxyConfig
typeDefs.description: Proxy server configurations to be used with the HTTP client endpoint.

fields.name: host
fields.description: Host name of the proxy server

fields.name: port
fields.description: Proxy server port

fields.name: userName
fields.description: Proxy server username

fields.name: password
fields.description: proxy server password

typeDefs.name: ClientHttp2Settings
typeDefs.description: Provides settings related to HTTP/2 protocol.

fields.name: http2PriorKnowledge
fields.description: Configuration to enable HTTP/2 prior knowledge

fields.name: http2InitialWindowSize
fields.description: Configuration to change the initial window size

typeDefs.name: FollowRedirects
typeDefs.description:
Provides configurations for controlling the endpoint's behaviour in response to HTTP redirect related responses.
The response status codes of 301, 302, and 303 are redirected using a GET request while 300, 305, 307, and 308
status codes use the original request HTTP method during redirection.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Enable/disable redirection

fields.name: maxCount
fields.description: Maximum number of redirects to follow

fields.name: allowAuthHeaders
fields.description:
By default Authorization and Proxy-Authorization headers are removed from the redirect requests.
Set it to true if Auth headers are needed to be sent during the redirection

typeDefs.name: PoolConfiguration
typeDefs.description: Configurations for managing HTTP client connection pool.

fields.name: maxActiveConnections
fields.description: Max active connections per route(host:port). Default value is -1 which indicates unlimited.

fields.name: maxIdleConnections
fields.description: Maximum number of idle connections allowed per pool.

fields.name: waitTime
fields.description: Maximum amount of time (in seconds), the client should wait for an idle connection before it sends an error when the pool is exhausted

fields.name: maxActiveStreamsPerConnection
fields.description: Maximum active streams per connection. This only applies to HTTP/2. Default value is 100

fields.name: minEvictableIdleTime
fields.description: Minimum evictable time for an idle connection in seconds. Default value is 5 minutes

fields.name: timeBetweenEvictionRuns
fields.description: Time between eviction runs in seconds. Default value is 30 seconds

fields.name: minIdleTimeInStaleState
fields.description:
Minimum time in seconds for a connection to be kept open which has received a GOAWAY.
This only applies for HTTP/2. Default value is 5 minutes. If the value is set to -1,
the connection will be closed after all in-flight streams are completed

fields.name: timeBetweenStaleEviction
fields.description:
Time between the connection stale eviction runs in seconds. This only applies for HTTP/2.
Default value is 30 seconds

typeDefs.name: CircuitBreakerConfig
typeDefs.description: Provides a set of configurations for controlling the behaviour of the Circuit Breaker.

fields.name: rollingWindow
fields.description: The `http:RollingWindow` options of the `CircuitBreaker`

fields.name: failureThreshold
fields.description:
The threshold for request failures. When this threshold exceeds, the circuit trips. The threshold should be a
value between 0 and 1

fields.name: resetTime
fields.description: The time period (in seconds) to wait before attempting to make another request to the upstream service

fields.name: statusCodes
fields.description: Array of HTTP response status codes which are considered as failures

typeDefs.name: RollingWindow
typeDefs.description: Represents a rolling window in the Circuit Breaker.

fields.name: requestVolumeThreshold
fields.description: Minimum number of requests in a `RollingWindow` that will trip the circuit.

fields.name: timeWindow
fields.description: Time period in seconds for which the failure threshold is calculated

fields.name: bucketSize
fields.description: The granularity at which the time window slides. This is measured in seconds.

typeDefs.name: RetryConfig
typeDefs.description: Provides configurations for controlling the retrying behavior in failure scenarios.

fields.name: count
fields.description: Number of retry attempts before giving up

fields.name: interval
fields.description: Retry interval in seconds

fields.name: backOffFactor
fields.description: Multiplier, which increases the retry interval exponentially.

fields.name: maxWaitInterval
fields.description: Maximum time of the retry interval in seconds

fields.name: statusCodes
fields.description: HTTP response status codes which are considered as failures

typeDefs.name: CookieConfig
typeDefs.description: Client configuration for cookies.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: User agents provide users with a mechanism for disabling or enabling cookies

fields.name: maxCookiesPerDomain
fields.description: Maximum number of cookies per domain, which is 50

fields.name: maxTotalCookieCount
fields.description: Maximum number of total cookies allowed to be stored in cookie store, which is 3000

fields.name: blockThirdPartyCookies
fields.description: User can block cookies from third party responses and refuse to send cookies for third party requests, if needed

fields.name: persistentCookieHandler
fields.description:
To manage persistent cookies, users are provided with a mechanism for specifying a persistent cookie store with their own mechanism
which references the persistent cookie handler or specifying the CSV persistent cookie handler. If not specified any, only the session cookies are used

typeDefs.name: ResponseLimitConfigs
typeDefs.description: Provides inbound response status line, total header and entity body size threshold configurations.

fields.name: maxStatusLineLength
fields.description:
Maximum allowed length for response status line(`HTTP/1.1 200 OK`). Exceeding this limit will
result in a `ClientError`

fields.name: maxHeaderSize
fields.description: Maximum allowed size for headers. Exceeding this limit will result in a `ClientError`

fields.name: maxEntityBodySize
fields.description:
Maximum allowed size for the entity body. By default it is set to -1 which means there is no
restriction `maxEntityBodySize`, On the Exceeding this limit will result in a `ClientError`

typeDefs.name: ClientSocketConfig
typeDefs.description: Provides settings related to client socket configuration.

fields.name: connectTimeOut
fields.description:
Connect timeout of the channel in seconds. If the Channel does not support connect operation,
this property is not used at all, and therefore will be ignored.

fields.name: receiveBufferSize
fields.description: Sets the SO_RCVBUF option to the specified value for this Socket.

fields.name: sendBufferSize
fields.description: Sets the SO_SNDBUF option to the specified value for this Socket.

fields.name: tcpNoDelay
fields.description: Enable/disable TCP_NODELAY (disable/enable Nagle's algorithm).

fields.name: socketReuse
fields.description: Enable/disable the SO_REUSEADDR socket option.

fields.name: keepAlive
fields.description: Enable/disable SO_KEEPALIVE.

typeDefs.name: ClientConfiguration
typeDefs.description:
Provides a set of configurations for controlling the behaviours when communicating with a remote HTTP endpoint.
The following fields are inherited from the other configuration records in addition to the `Client`-specific
configs.

fields.name: secureSocket
fields.description: SSL/TLS security settings for HTTPS connections

typeDefs.name: Method
typeDefs.description: Represents HTTP methods.

typeDefs.name: ClientObject
typeDefs.description: The representation of the http Client object type for managing resilient clients.

typeDefs.name: PathParamType

typeDefs.name: SimpleQueryParamType

typeDefs.name: QueryParamType
typeDefs.description: Defines the query parameter type supported with client resource methods.

typeDefs.name: QueryParams
typeDefs.description: Defines the record type of query parameters supported with client resource methods.

fields.name: headers
fields.description: headers which cannot be used as a query field

fields.name: targetType
fields.description: targetType which cannot be used as a query field

fields.name: message
fields.description: message which cannot be used as a query field

fields.name: mediaType
fields.description: mediaType which cannot be used as a query field

fields.description: Configuration to change the initial window size in HTTP/2

fields.name: minIdleTimeInStaleState
fields.description:
Minimum time in seconds for a connection to be kept open which has received a GOAWAY.
This only applies for HTTP/2. Default value is 5 minutes. If the value is set to -1,
the connection will be closed after all in-flight streams are completed

fields.name: timeBetweenStaleEviction
fields.description:
Time between the connection stale eviction runs in seconds. This only applies for HTTP/2.
Default value is 30 seconds

fields.name: keepAlive
fields.description:
Can be set to either `KEEPALIVE_AUTO`, which respects the `connection` header, or `KEEPALIVE_ALWAYS`,
which always keeps the connection alive, or `KEEPALIVE_NEVER`, which always closes the connection

fields.name: maxPipelinedRequests
fields.description:
Defines the maximum number of requests that can be processed at a given time on a single
connection. By default 10 requests can be pipelined on a single connection and user can
change this limit appropriately.

functions.name: setEntity
functions.description: Sets the provided `Entity` to the request.

parameters.name: e
parameters.description: The `Entity` to be set to the request

functions.name: getQueryParams
functions.description: Gets the query parameters of the request as a map consisting of a string array.

return.description: String array map of the query params

functions.name: getQueryParamValue
functions.description: Gets the query param value associated with the given key.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Represents the query param key

return.description:
The query param value associated with the given key as a string. If multiple param values are
present, then the first value is returned. `()` is returned if no key is found.

functions.name: getQueryParamValues
functions.description: Gets all the query param values associated with the given key.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Represents the query param key

return.description:
All the query param values associated with the given key as a `string[]`. `()` is returned if no key
is found.

functions.name: getMatrixParams
functions.description: Gets the matrix parameters of the request.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path to the location of matrix parameters

return.description: A map of matrix parameters which can be found for the given path

functions.name: getEntity
functions.description: Gets the `Entity` associated with the request.

return.description: The `Entity` of the request. An `http:ClientError` is returned, if entity construction fails

functions.name: hasHeader
functions.description: Checks whether the requested header key exists in the header map.

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: The header name

return.description: `true` if the specified header key exists

functions.name: getHeader
functions.description:
Returns the value of the specified header. If the specified header key maps to multiple values, the first of
these values is returned.

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: The header name

return.description:
The first header value for the specified header name or the `HeaderNotFoundError` if the header is not
found.

functions.name: getHeaders
functions.description: Gets all the header values to which the specified header key maps to.

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: The header name

return.description:
The header values the specified header key maps to or the `HeaderNotFoundError` if the header is not
found.

functions.name: setHeader
functions.description:
Sets the specified header to the request. If a mapping already exists for the specified header key, the existing
header value is replaced with the specified header value. Panic if an illegal header is passed.

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: The header name

parameters.name: headerValue
parameters.description: The header value

functions.name: addHeader
functions.description:
Adds the specified header to the request. Existing header values are not replaced, except for the `Content-Type`
header. In the case of the `Content-Type` header, the existing value is replaced with the specified value.
Panic if an illegal header is passed.

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: The header name

parameters.name: headerValue
parameters.description: The header value

functions.name: removeHeader
functions.description: Removes the specified header from the request.

parameters.name: headerName
parameters.description: The header name

functions.name: removeAllHeaders
functions.description: Removes all the headers from the request.

functions.name: getHeaderNames
functions.description: Gets all the names of the headers of the request.

return.description: An array of all the header names

functions.name: expects100Continue
functions.description: Checks whether the client expects a `100-continue` response.

return.description: `true` if the client expects a `100-continue` response

functions.name: setContentType
functions.description: Sets the `content-type` header to the request.

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description: Content type value to be set as the `content-type` header

return.description: Nil if successful, error in case of invalid content-type

functions.name: getContentType
functions.description: Gets the type of the payload of the request (i.e: the `content-type` header value).

return.description: The `content-type` header value as a string

functions.name: getJsonPayload
functions.description:
Extract `json` payload from the request. For an empty payload, `http:NoContentError` is returned.

If the content type is not JSON, an `http:ClientError` is returned.

return.description: The `json` payload or `http:ClientError` in case of errors

functions.name: getXmlPayload
functions.description:
Extracts `xml` payload from the request. For an empty payload, `http:NoContentError` is returned.

If the content type is not XML, an `http:ClientError` is returned.

return.description: The `xml` payload or `http:ClientError` in case of errors

functions.name: getTextPayload
functions.description:
Extracts `text` payload from the request. For an empty payload, `http:NoContentError` is returned.

If the content type is not of type text, an `http:ClientError` is returned.

return.description: The `text` payload or `http:ClientError` in case of errors

functions.name: getByteStream
functions.description:
Gets the request payload as  a stream of byte[], except in the case of multiparts. To retrieve multiparts, use
`Request.getBodyParts()`.

parameters.name: arraySize
parameters.description: A defaultable parameter to state the size of the byte array. Default size is 8KB

return.description: A byte stream from which the message payload can be read or `http:ClientError` in case of errors

functions.name: getBinaryPayload
functions.description: Gets the request payload as a `byte[]`.

return.description: The byte[] representation of the message payload or `http:ClientError` in case of errors

functions.name: getFormParams
functions.description: Gets the form parameters from the HTTP request as a `map` when content type is application/x-www-form-urlencoded.

return.description: The map of form params or `http:ClientError` in case of errors

functions.name: getBodyParts
functions.description:
Extracts body parts from the request. If the content type is not a composite media type, an error
is returned.

return.description:
The body parts as an array of entities or else an `http:ClientError` if there were any errors
constructing the body parts from the request

functions.name: setJsonPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `json` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/json`. Any existing content-type can be
overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter. If the given payload is a record type with 
the `@jsondata:Name` annotation, the `jsondata:toJson` function internally converts the record to JSON

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `json` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/json` is the default value

functions.name: setXmlPayload
functions.description:
Sets an `xml` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/xml`. Any existing content-type can be
overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `xml` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/xml` is the default value

functions.name: setTextPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `string` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set
content-type headers with the default content-type, which is `text/plain`. Any
existing content-type can be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `string` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `text/plain` is the default value

functions.name: setBinaryPayload
functions.description:
Sets a `byte[]` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/octet-stream`. Any existing content-type
can be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: The `byte[]` payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/octet-stream` is the default value

functions.name: setBodyParts
functions.description:
Set multiparts as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method
set content-type headers with the default content-type, which is `multipart/form-data`.
Any existing content-type can be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: bodyParts
parameters.description: The entities which make up the message body

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the top level message. This is an optional parameter.
The `multipart/form-data` is the default value

functions.name: setFileAsPayload
functions.description:
Sets the content of the specified file as the entity body of the request. If the content-type header
is not set then this method set content-type headers with the default content-type, which is
`application/octet-stream`. Any existing content-type can be overridden by passing the content-type
as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: filePath
parameters.description: Path to the file to be set as the payload

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
The content type of the specified file. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/octet-stream` is the default value

functions.name: setByteStream
functions.description:
Sets a `Stream` as the payload. If the content-type header is not set then this method set content-type
headers with the default content-type, which is `application/octet-stream`. Any existing content-type can
be overridden by passing the content-type as an optional parameter.

parameters.name: byteStream
parameters.description: Byte stream, which needs to be set to the request

parameters.name: contentType
parameters.description:
Content-type to be used with the payload. This is an optional parameter.
The `application/octet-stream` is the default value

functions.name: setPayload
functions.description:
Sets the request payload. This method overrides any existing content-type by passing the content-type
as an optional parameter. If the content type parameter is not provided then the default value derived
from the payload will be used as content-type only when there are no existing content-type header.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description:
Payload can be of type `string`, `xml`, `byte[]`, `json`, `stream<byte[], io:Error?>`,
`Entity[]` (i.e., a set of body parts) or any other value of type `anydata` which will
be converted to `json` using the `toJson` method.

typeDefs.name: HttpOperation
typeDefs.description:
Defines the HTTP operations related to circuit breaker, failover and load balancer.

`FORWARD`: Forward the specified payload
`GET`: Request a resource
`POST`: Create a new resource
`DELETE`: Deletes the specified resource
`OPTIONS`: Request communication options available
`PUT`: Replace the target resource
`PATCH`: Apply partial modification to the resource
`HEAD`: Identical to `GET` but no resource body should be returned
`SUBMIT`: Submits a http request and returns an HttpFuture object
`NONE`: No operation should be performed

typeDefs.name: FailoverClientConfiguration
typeDefs.description:
Provides a set of HTTP related configurations and failover related configurations.
The following fields are inherited from the other configuration records in addition to the failover client-specific
configs.

fields.name: targets
fields.description: The upstream HTTP endpoints among which the incoming HTTP traffic load should be sent on failover

fields.name: failoverCodes
fields.description: Array of HTTP response status codes for which the failover behaviour should be triggered

fields.name: interval
fields.description: Failover delay interval in seconds

typeDefs.name: CircuitState
typeDefs.description:
A finite type for modeling the states of the Circuit Breaker. The Circuit Breaker starts in the `CLOSED` state.
If any failure thresholds are exceeded during execution, the circuit trips and goes to the `OPEN` state. After
the specified timeout period expires, the circuit goes to the `HALF_OPEN` state. If the trial request sent while
in the `HALF_OPEN` state succeeds, the circuit goes back to the `CLOSED` state.

typeDefs.name: CircuitHealth
typeDefs.description: Maintains the health of the Circuit Breaker.

fields.name: lastRequestSuccess
fields.description: Whether last request is success or not

fields.name: totalRequestCount
fields.description: Total request count received within the `RollingWindow`

fields.name: lastUsedBucketId
fields.description: ID of the last bucket used in Circuit Breaker calculations

fields.name: startTime
fields.description: Circuit Breaker start time

fields.name: lastRequestTime
fields.description: The time that the last request received

fields.name: lastErrorTime
fields.description: The time that the last error occurred

fields.name: lastForcedOpenTime
fields.description: The time that circuit forcefully opened at last

fields.name: totalBuckets
fields.description: The discrete time buckets into which the time window is divided

typeDefs.name: Bucket
typeDefs.description: Represents a discrete sub-part of the time window (Bucket).

fields.name: totalCount
fields.description: Total number of requests received during the sub-window time frame

fields.name: failureCount
fields.description: Number of failed requests during the sub-window time frame

fields.name: rejectedCount
fields.description: Number of rejected requests during the sub-window time frame

fields.name: lastUpdatedTime
fields.description: The time that the `Bucket` is last updated.

typeDefs.name: CircuitBreakerInferredConfig
typeDefs.description: Derived set of configurations from the `CircuitBreakerConfig`.

fields.name: failureThreshold
fields.description:
The threshold for request failures. When this threshold exceeds, the circuit trips.
The threshold should be a value between 0 and 1

fields.name: resetTime
fields.description:
The time period (in seconds) to wait before attempting to make another request to
the upstream service

fields.name: statusCodes
fields.description: Array of HTTP response status codes which are considered as failures

fields.name: noOfBuckets
fields.description: Number of buckets derived from the `RollingWindow`

fields.name: rollingWindow
fields.description: The `http:RollingWindow` options provided in the `http:CircuitBreakerConfig`

functions.name: submit
functions.description: Send an asynchronous HTTP request that does not wait for the response immediately. Can be used for non-blocking operations.

parameters.name: httpVerb
parameters.description:
The HTTP verb value. The HTTP verb is case-sensitive. Use the `http:Method` type to specify the
the standard HTTP methods.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The resource path

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: An HTTP outbound request or any allowed payload

return.description: An `http:HttpFuture` that represents an asynchronous service invocation or else an `http:ClientError` if the submission fails

functions.name: getResponse
functions.description: Get the response from a previously submitted asynchronous request. Can be used after calling `submit()` action to retrieve the actual response.

parameters.name: httpFuture
parameters.description: The `http:HttpFuture` related to a previous asynchronous invocation

return.description: An `http:Response` message or else an `http: ClientError` if the invocation fails

functions.name: hasPromise
functions.description: Check if the server has sent a push promise for additional resources. Should be used with HTTP/2 server push functionality.

parameters.name: httpFuture
parameters.description: The `http:HttpFuture` relates to a previous asynchronous invocation

return.description: A `boolean`, which represents whether an `http:PushPromise` exists

functions.name: getNextPromise
functions.description: Get the next server push promise that contains information about additional resources the server wants to send.

parameters.name: httpFuture
parameters.description: The `http:HttpFuture` related to a previous asynchronous invocation

return.description: An `http:PushPromise` message or else an `http:ClientError` if the invocation fails

functions.name: getPromisedResponse
functions.description: Get the actual response data from a server push promise. Can be used to receive resources that the server proactively sends.

parameters.name: promise
parameters.description: The related `http:PushPromise`

return.description: A promised `http:Response` message or else an `http:ClientError` if the invocation fails

functions.name: rejectPromise
functions.description: Reject a server push promise to decline receiving the additional resource.

parameters.name: promise
parameters.description: The Push Promise to be rejected

functions.name: getCookieStore
functions.description: Get the cookie storage associated with this HTTP client. Can be used to access stored cookies for session management.

return.description: The cookie store related to the client

functions.name: circuitBreakerForceClose
functions.description:
Force the circuit breaker to allow all requests through, ignoring current error rates. Can be used to manually
restore service after fixing issues.

functions.name: circuitBreakerForceOpen
functions.description:
Force the circuit breaker to block all requests until the reset time expires. Can be used to manually stop
requests during maintenance or known issues.

functions.name: getCircuitBreakerCurrentState
functions.description: Check the current state of the circuit breaker. Can be used to monitor the health status of your HTTP connections.

return.description: The current `http:CircuitState` of the circuit breaker

functions.name: getRemoteHostName
functions.description:
Gets the hostname from the remote address. This method may trigger a DNS reverse lookup if the address was created
with a literal IP address.
```ballerina
string? remoteHost = caller.getRemoteHostName();
```

return.description: The hostname of the address or else `()` if it is unresolved

clients.name: StatusCodeClient
clients.description:
The HTTP status code client provides the capability for initiating contact with a remote HTTP service. The API it
provides includes the functions for the standard HTTP methods forwarding a received request and sending requests
using custom HTTP verbs. The responses can be binded to `http:StatusCodeResponse` types

functions.name: init
functions.description:
Gets invoked to initialize the `client`. During initialization, the configurations provided through the `config`
record is used to determine which type of additional behaviours are added to the endpoint (e.g., caching,
security, circuit breaking).

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: URL of the target service

parameters.name: httpVersion
parameters.description: HTTP protocol version supported by the client

parameters.name: http1Settings
parameters.description: HTTP/1.x specific settings

parameters.name: http2Settings
parameters.description: HTTP/2 specific settings

parameters.name: timeout
parameters.description: Maximum time(in seconds) to wait for a response before the request times out

parameters.name: forwarded
parameters.description: The choice of setting `Forwarded`/`X-Forwarded-For` header, when acting as a proxy

parameters.name: followRedirects
parameters.description: HTTP redirect handling configurations (with 3xx status codes)

parameters.name: poolConfig
parameters.description: Configurations associated with the request connection pool

parameters.name: cache
parameters.description: HTTP response caching related configurations

parameters.name: compression
parameters.description: Enable request/response compression (using `accept-encoding` header)

parameters.name: auth
parameters.description: Client authentication options (Basic, Bearer token, OAuth, etc.)

parameters.name: circuitBreaker
parameters.description: Circuit breaker configurations to prevent cascading failures

parameters.name: retryConfig
parameters.description: Automatic retry settings for failed requests

parameters.name: cookieConfig
parameters.description: Cookie handling settings for session management

parameters.name: responseLimits
parameters.description: Limits for response size and headers (to prevent memory issues)

parameters.name: proxy
parameters.description: Proxy server settings if requests need to go through a proxy

parameters.name: validation
parameters.description: Enable automatic payload validation for request/response data against constraints

parameters.name: socketConfig
parameters.description: Low-level socket settings (timeouts, buffer sizes, etc.)

parameters.name: laxDataBinding
parameters.description:
Enable relaxed data binding on the client side.
When enabled:
- `null` values in JSON are allowed to be mapped to optional fields
- missing fields in JSON are allowed to be mapped as `null` values

parameters.name: secureSocket
parameters.description: SSL/TLS security settings for HTTPS connections

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: The configurations to be used when initializing the `client`

return.description: The `client` or an `http:ClientError` if the initialization failed

requests regardless of the error percentage until the failure threshold exceeds.

functions.name: submit
functions.description:
Submits an HTTP request to a service with the specified HTTP verb. The `FailoverClient.submit()` function does not
return an `http:Response` as the result. Rather it returns an `http:HttpFuture` which can be used for subsequent interactions
with the HTTP endpoint.

parameters.name: httpVerb
parameters.description:
The HTTP verb value. The HTTP verb is case-sensitive. Use the `http:Method` type to specify the
the standard HTTP methods.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: The resource path

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: An HTTP outbound request or any allowed payload

return.description:
An `http:HttpFuture` that represents an asynchronous service invocation or else an `http:ClientError` if the submission
fails

functions.name: getResponse
functions.description: Retrieves the `http:Response` for a previously-submitted request.

parameters.name: httpFuture
parameters.description: The `http:HttpFuture` related to a previous asynchronous invocation

return.description: An `http:Response` message or else an `http:ClientError` if the invocation fails

functions.name: hasPromise
functions.description: Checks whether an `http:PushPromise` exists for a previously-submitted request.

parameters.name: httpFuture
parameters.description: The `http:HttpFuture` related to a previous asynchronous invocation

return.description: A `boolean`, which represents whether an `http:PushPromise` exists

functions.name: getNextPromise
functions.description: Retrieves the next available `http:PushPromise` for a previously-submitted request.

parameters.name: httpFuture
parameters.description: The `http:HttpFuture` related to a previous asynchronous invocation

return.description: An `http:PushPromise` message or else an `http:ClientError` if the invocation fails

functions.name: getPromisedResponse
functions.description: Retrieves the promised server push `http:Response` message.

parameters.name: promise
parameters.description: The related `http:PushPromise`

return.description: A promised `http:Response` message or else an `http:ClientError` if the invocation fails

functions.name: rejectPromise
functions.description:
Rejects an `http:PushPromise`. When an `http:PushPromise` is rejected, there is no chance of fetching a promised
response using the rejected promise.

parameters.name: promise
parameters.description: The Push Promise to be rejected

functions.name: getSucceededEndpointIndex
functions.description: Gets the index of the `TargetService[]` array which given a successful response.

return.description: The successful target endpoint index

or else an `http:ClientError`

functions.name: parseHeader
functions.description:
Parses the header value which contains multiple values or parameters.
```ballerina
 http:HeaderValue[] values = check http:parseHeader("text/plain;level=1;q=0.6, application/xml;level=2");
```

parameters.name: headerValue
parameters.description: The header value

return.description:
An array of `http:HeaderValue` typed record containing the value and its parameter map
or else an `http:ClientError` if the header parsing fails

functions.name: getHeaderMap

parameters.name: headers
parameters.description: The headers represented as a map of anydata

return.description: A map of string or string array representing the headers

functions.name: getQueryMap

parameters.name: queries
parameters.description: The queries represented as a map of anydata

return.description: The queries map with names specified by the `http:Query` annotation

functions.name: getDefaultListener
functions.description:
Returns the default HTTP listener. If the default listener is not already created, a new
listener will be created with the port and configuration. An error will be returned if
the listener creation fails.

The default listener configuration can be changed in the `Config.toml` file. Example:
```toml
[ballerina.http]
defaultListenerPort = 8080
[ballerina.http.defaultListenerConfig]
httpVersion = "1.1"
[ballerina.http.defaultListenerConfig.secureSocket.key]
path = "resources/certs/key.pem"
password = "password"
```

return.description: The default HTTP listener or an error if the listener creation fails.

functions.name: createHttpSecureClient
functions.description: Creates an HTTP client capable of securing HTTP requests with authentication.

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: Base URL

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: Client endpoint configurations

return.description: Created secure HTTP client

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: Listening port of the HTTP service listener

services.testGenerationInstruction:
# Test Generation Instructions for HTTP Services

Generated test code following these strict guidelines:

## Library Requirements
- Search for `ballerina/test` library if you still haven't done so to get information on the core test framework and adhere to instructions provided there in addition to these.

## Test File Structure:
- Start with necessary imports, including `ballerina/http`, `ballerina/test` any other imports that is required.
- Define an HTTP Client at the module level named `clientEp`
- Organize tests logically: create, read, update, delete
- Create helper functions only when improving readability
- Don't redefine existing types from the codebase, reuse them.

## Test Function Generation:
- MUST generate AT LEAST ONE test case for EACH resource function
- Ensure each test function returns `error?` and use `check` keyword for error propagation.
- Use proper HTTP method invocation syntax as per the provided example.
    - GET:
        - Ballerina Resource -> resource function get books/[string isbn]() returns Book|Error
        - Resource invocation -> {Type} {variableName} = check clientEp->/books/[{isbn}]();
        - Example -> Book book = check clientEp->/books/[12345678]();
    - POST:
        - Ballerina Resource -> resource function post books(@http:Payload Book newBook) returns string|error
        - Resource invocation -> {Type} {variableName} = clientEp->/books.post({payload});
        - Example -> Book book = check clientEp->/books.post(definedBook);
    - PUT:
        - Ballerina Resource -> resource function put books/[string isbn](@http:Payload Book updatedBook, @http:Query string name) returns string|error
        - Resource invocation -> {Type} {variableName} = clientEp->/books/[{isbn}].put({payload}, name = {value});
        - Example -> Book book = check clientEp->/books/isbn-number.put(definedUpdatedBook, name = "BookName");
    - DELETE:
        - Ballerina Resource -> resource function delete books(@http:Query string isbn) returns string|error
        - Resource invocation -> {Type} {variableName} = clientEp->/books.delete(isbn = {value});
    - PATCH:
        - Ballerina Resource -> resource function patch books/[string isbn](@http:Payload Book updatedBook, @http:Query string name) returns string|error
        - Resource invocation -> {Type} {variableName} = clientEp->/books/[{isbn}].patch({payload}, name = {value});
- For non-annotated resource function parameters, treat records as body params and others as query params.
- When generating negative test cases, focus only on scenarios that are explicitly handled in the existing code base and avoid generating tests for theoretical edge cases not addressed in the current codebase.

## Response Handling:
- Use direct data binding for positive test cases based on source code or type schemas.
- For negative test cases, use `http:Response` variables and check status codes.
- Always assign responses to variables with specific types.

functions.name: init

functions.name: read
functions.description:
Source bytes from a given input resource.
This operation will be asynchronous in which the total number of required bytes might not be returned at a given
time. An `io:EofError` will return once the channel reaches the end.
```ballerina
byte[]|io:Error result = readableByteChannel.read(1000);
```

parameters.name: nBytes
parameters.description: A positive integer. Represents the number of bytes, which should be read

return.description: Content (the number of bytes) read, an `EofError` once the channel reaches the end or else an `io:Error`

functions.name: readAll
functions.description:
Read all content of the channel as a `byte` array and return a read only `byte` array.
```ballerina
byte[]|io:Error result = readableByteChannel.readAll();
```

return.description: A read-only `byte` array or else an `io:Error`

functions.name: blockStream
functions.description:
Return a block stream that can be used to read all `byte` blocks as a stream.
```ballerina
stream<io:Block, io:Error>|io:Error result = readableByteChannel.blockStream();
```

parameters.name: blockSize
parameters.description: A positive integer. Size of the block.

return.description: A block stream or else an `io:Error`

functions.name: base64Encode
functions.description:
Encodes a given `io:ReadableByteChannel` using the Base64 encoding scheme.
```ballerina
io:ReadableByteChannel|Error encodedChannel = readableByteChannel.base64Encode();
```

return.description: An encoded `io:ReadableByteChannel` or else an `io:Error`

functions.name: base64Decode
functions.description:
Decodes a given Base64 encoded `io:ReadableByteChannel`.
```ballerina
io:ReadableByteChannel|Error encodedChannel = readableByteChannel.base64Decode();
```

return.description: A decoded `io:ReadableByteChannel` or else an `io:Error`

functions.name: close
functions.description:
Closes the `io:ReadableByteChannel`.
After a channel is closed, any further reading operations will cause an error.
```ballerina
io:Error? err = readableByteChannel.close();
```

return.description: `()` or else an `io:Error` if any error occurred

functions.description:
Reads a given number of characters. This will attempt to read up to the `numberOfChars` characters of the channel.
An `io:EofError` will return once the channel reaches the end.


return.description:
The characters that read as a string, an `io:EofError` once the channel reaches the end, or else an
`io:Error` if something went wrong while reading

typeDefs.name: Format
typeDefs.description:
The format, which will be used to represent the CSV.

DEFAULT - The default value is the format specified by the CSVChannel. Precedence will be given to the field
separator and record separator.

CSV - Field separator will be "," and the record separator will be a new line.

TDF - Field separator will be a tab and the record separator will be a new line.

typeDefs.name: Separator
typeDefs.description:
Field separators, which are supported by the `DelimitedTextRecordChannel`.

COMMA - Delimited text records will be separated using a comma

TAB - Delimited text records will be separated using a tab

COLON - Delimited text records will be separated using a colon(:)

typeDefs.description: Represents IO module related errors.

typeDefs.name: ConnectionTimedOutError
typeDefs.description: This will return when connection timed out happen when try to connect to a remote host.

typeDefs.name: GenericError
typeDefs.description: Represents generic IO error. The detail record contains the information related to the error.

typeDefs.name: AccessDeniedError
typeDefs.description: This will get returned due to file permission issues.

typeDefs.name: FileNotFoundError
typeDefs.description: This will get returned if the file is not available in the given file path.

typeDefs.name: TypeMismatchError
typeDefs.description: This will get returned when there is an mismatch of given type and the expected type.

typeDefs.name: EofError
typeDefs.description: This will get returned if read operations are performed on a channel after it closed.

typeDefs.name: ConfigurationError
typeDefs.description: This will get returned if there is an invalid configuration.

typeDefs.name: FileWriteOption
typeDefs.description: Represents a file opening options for writing.

typeDefs.name: XmlEntityType
typeDefs.description: Represents the XML entity type that needs to be written.

typeDefs.name: XmlDoctype
typeDefs.description: Represents the XML DOCTYPE entity.

typeDefs.description: The writing options of an XML.

fields.description: XML DOCTYPE value (the default value is `()`)

typeDefs.name: PrintableRawTemplate
typeDefs.description:
Represents raw templates.
e.g: `The respective int value is ${val}`

typeDefs.name: Printable
typeDefs.description:
Defines all the printable types.
1. any typed value
2. errors
3. `io:PrintableRawTemplate` - an raw templated value

typeDefs.name: FileOutputStream
typeDefs.description:
Defines the output streaming types.
1. `stdout` - standard output stream
2. `stderr` - standard error stream

typeDefs.description:
Represents network byte order.

BIG_ENDIAN - specifies the bytes to be in the order of most significant byte first.

LITTLE_ENDIAN - specifies the byte order to be the least significant byte first.
